meanings.definition: Strongly encourage or urge (someone) to do something.
meanings.sent1: The coach exhorts his players to give their best effort in every game.
meanings.sent2: She exhorts her friends to join her in volunteering at the local shelter.
meanings.sent3: The teacher exhorts the sleepy students to wake up and participate in the class.
meanings.sent4: The motivational speaker exhorts the audience to break free from their comfort zones.
meanings.sent5: The parent exhorts their child to always speak the truth, no matter what.

meanings.definition: Make a strong appeal for action or change.
meanings.sent1: The activist exhorts the community to come together and demand justice.
meanings.sent2: The environmentalist exhorts people to reduce their carbon footprint for a greener planet.
meanings.sent3: The politician exhorts voters to support policies that benefit everyone.
meanings.sent4: The artist exhorts viewers to see beyond the surface and appreciate the deeper meaning of the artwork.
meanings.sent5: The leader exhorts the team to strive for excellence and never settle for mediocrity.
